Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: The 92 Group has contributed to a strengthened focus on the perspectives and interests of poor and vulnerable people in connection with the development of the new global post 2020 goals under the UN Biodiversity Convention (CBD)

The 92 Group has followed and provided coordinated NGO input to the international biodiversity process up to CBD COP15, and in this process helped insure focus and attention on the interests and priorities of poor and vulnerable people in developing countries.

actual.value: 2020, there has been an ongoing dialogue with the Ministry of the Environment and Food on international biodiversity efforts, through a series of meetings. During the period, a good dialogue process was developed with the ministry. In 2019, the 92 Group worked for the Ministry of the Environment and Food to establish a dialogue forum for cooperation and broader involvement of Danish stakeholders in connection with the international biodiversity process. As a result of this continued efforts and cooperation with the Ministry of the Environment, the first meeting of the new forum was held in October 2019, with a broad circle of representatives from business and NGOs. The 92 group has participated and contributed to the first stakeholder meetings arranged by the Ministry of the Environment and Food and is planning a new one in collaboration with the ministry in November 2020.

title.narrative: To ensure a strong and coordinated Danish civil society, which effectively influences international fora, discussions, and decisions on sustainable development in developing countries, specifically within the areas of implementation of the SDG’s, climate action, CSR and biodiversity. Additionally, the objective is to increase public awareness of and popular engagement in development issues in Denmark.

The 92 Group has contributed to the inclusion of the perspectives of civil society and poor and vulnerable people from developing countries in Danish and EU efforts to promote Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR).

The 92 Group has contributed to ensuring that Danish policies on responsible business conduct has a focus on ensuring human rights, environment and sustainable development in developing countries. This includes that the 92 Group has contributed to ensuring political support for regulation and legislation (e.g. “lovpligtig due diligence”) that ensures these priorities.

actual.value: One of the main results for this output in 2020 has been the conference on legally binding due diligence in September 2020. Through the preparation of the conference, the panellists’ speaking papers, the agenda and the formulation of critical 19 questions, the issues of human rights and environmentally sustainable development have been brought forward into the political and public spheres, as well as the private sector.

title.narrative: The 92 Group has contributed to a strengthened focus on the perspectives of developing countries in relation to the global implementation of the Paris Agreement and the formulation of new objectives and climate targets (NDCs) in the process up to COP26.

The 92 Group has followed and provided coordinated NGO input to the international climate processes and meetings, the UNFCCC and COP26 including with a focus on the interest and positions of the poor and most vulnerable countries and people. The 92 Group has been instrumental in ensuring that the new Danish climate law and climate action plan (“klimahandlingsplan”) also has focus on the need for sustainable development for poor and vulnerable people in developing countries (e.g. through the “global pillar” (globale søjle)).

actual.value: The 92 Group continues to focus on the international climate negotiations at UN level. In December 2019 the 92 Group participated in COP25 in Madrid with a large NGO delegation, and actively followed the negotiations on a wide range of topics. The 92 Group gave input to the Danish government, at daily meetings and briefings with the delegation, the Minister of Climate, the parliamentary delegation, as well as journalists before and during the COP. The result of this effort was a well-functioning and broad Danish NGO delegation, which had an influence on several Danish positions.

title.narrative: The 92 Group has ensured that the coordinated perspectives of civil society as well as those of poor and vulnerable people from developing countries are included in Danish, EU, and UN efforts to realise the Sustainable Development Goals.

The 92 Group has coordinated civil society inputs and participation in connection with the relevant UN processes on the SDGs in 2020 including the High-Level Political Forum. The 92 Group has had a leading role in ensuring that there will be developed a new Danish national plan for the SDGs (“national handlingsplan”) and that this plan also has focus on ensuring sustainable development, global responsibility and policy coherence for poor and vulnerable people in developing countries.

target.value: The 92 Group has coordinated civil society inputs and participation in connection with the relevant UN processes on the SDGs in 2020 including the High-Level Political Forum. The 92 Group has had a leading role in ensuring that there will be developed a new Danish national plan for the SDGs (“national handlingsplan”) and that this plan also has focus on ensuring sustainable development, global responsibility and policy coherence for poor and vulnerable people in developing countries.

actual.value: The process around the 2020 High Leve Political Forum was special in 2020, due to the Covid-19 situation. All activities, such as side-event etc. were held on different virtual platforms. The virtual set-up made it very difficult to ensure civils society participation in general and even more so for countries in the global South, let alone vulnerable groups. The Danish 92 Group has actively participated in all relevant fora in relation to the Danish NAP, using every opportunity to speak for 17 the development of this plan. Together with Globalt Fokus and member organisations, the Danish 92 group has kept in touch with the political developments during Covid-19 and in the re-opening process, to ensure that the NAP is still on the political agenda. The 92 Group has worked for the 2030-panel to advocate for a NAP. This resulted in letters from the 2030-panel to the government (the Finance Minister) on this. This contributed to the government deciding to develop a NAP by the end of 2020.
